articles.description: Deveca Rose's two sets of twins died in a house fire while she was out shopping.
articles.title: Mother guilty over fire deaths of four sons

articles.description: In a historic move, the UK gives up sovereignty of a strategic group of islands in the Indian Ocean.
articles.title: UK hands sovereignty of Chagos Islands to Mauritius

articles.description: Student Isobel Taper says it feels "surreal" being back in the UK, having left her boyfriend and cats in Beirut.
articles.title: Lebanon: UK nationals tell of life left behind after evacuation

articles.description: An arrest has been made in connection with an acid attack outside a west London school.
articles.title: Arrest made over Westminster Academy acid attack

articles.description: A cruise ship stranded in Belfast for the past four months has finally left the city's lough.
articles.title: Stranded cruise ship Odyssey sails out of Belfast Lough

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The presenter's scheduled interview with Johnson was pulled after she accidentally sent him her notes.
articles.title: Laura Kuenssberg 'embarrassed' by Boris Johnson email error

articles.description: A Met Police marksman is accused of the murder of Chris Kaba who was shot in a car in south London.
articles.title: Chris Kaba aware police were following him, court told

articles.description: Eira Harris says the bungalow has been in her family for 70 years and is "not a home".
articles.title: Second homes: Hut with no toilet gets 300% council tax bill

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Colombia and a US firm are fighting over a shipwreck in the Caribbean Sea that could be worth $18bn.
articles.title: The fraught battle over the holy grail of shipwrecks

articles.description: Governor Andrew Bailey hints that borrowing costs could come down faster if inflation stays in line.
articles.title: Interest rates: Bank of England could be 'more aggressive' on cuts
